Jennifer Y
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Nishi Shinjuku Hotel Mystays is a practical hotel and a good base for exploring both the Shinjuku area as well as other areas of Tokyo. We reached the hotel easily by taking the limousine bus from the airport to the Hilton Shinjuku stop and then walked 5 minutes downhill to the Nishi Shinjuku Hotel. The Shinjuku station is about a 15 minute walk away. The Tokyo metropolitan government building was a 5-10 minute walk away and offers a great view of the city. If staying at this hotel its a can't miss option and free entry. The Shinjuku nightlife was mostly on the other side of the station and therefore a 15+ minute walk away. However there were some small Japanese style pubs (restaurants really by western standards) on the same street as the hotel. Also a CoCos curry house was right on the same street plus several convenience stores such as 7 eleven. Right next door was a MacDonald's.The staff were friendly but as we had researched the area before arrival we did not rely upon them much for info. The included breakfast was basic and a mix of both western and Japanese options.The toiletries provided were plenty and in addition to what is provided in the room there are additional items that you can choose yourself from the lobby. As all the reviews indicate the rooms are very small, but this was standard across all rooms we stayed in in Japan. The semi-double has a 120cm bed and minimal space for large luggage, I suggest to pack light. There was a washing machine available in the room as well as a microwave and kettle. Most hotels in Japan had do it yourself laundry facilities so there is no need to over pack. In short, the hotel is exactly as described. It has all you need for a basic comfortable stay in Tokyo.

Good: Not the smallest room we've stayed at in Japan. It actually has a very large bathroom (comparative to other Japanese bathrooms). Room has washing machine and very basic kitchen facilities. View from outside my widow was beautiful and the information paper on accessing porn on the tv was a first. Wifi was free, strong and insecure due to lack of password. There's a Maccas next door which you can still access the same free wifi from and a Sunkus and local milkbar down the street. The metro station is a few minutes walk and there's a few restaurants nearby.Bad: Staff were pretty much blase about everything - not the best service I've encountered in Japan tbh (we weren't even acknowledged by staff upon arrival and stood there looking like idiots until we managed to signal for someone else from behind the curtains to come out and help us). The AC in the room cooled half the room and kept the other half in stifling heat even on swing mode.

Nice hotel with modern room decoration, well in room facilities i.e. Microwave, washing machine. I stayed in a single room, though the room size is only 15 square metres but it is good enough for single occupancy. Location, I can't say it is excellent but good enough as there is a subway station nearby. There is a 24 hours supermarket nearby hotel by 3 mins walking distance.

Located a 15 minute walk from shinjuku station, this hotel was comfortable for our final days in Japan. I accidently booked a smoking room, however upon check in we realised and decided to potentially go elsewhere as the smell was very overpowering for us. The staff were very accommodating and allowed us to change rooms, for which we were very grateful. One big advantage is that there are washer/dryers in the bedroom which allowed us to wash our clothes before going home, saving me a big job once back.

I booked and stayed in a single room which was tiny but definitely reasonable for one person. Besides, I didn't come to Tokyo to sit around in the hotel room! The bathroom was sometimes smelly and I think this is typical with the prefab plastic style of Japanese bathrooms I've been used before. The shower pressure was perfect though! The bed only came with one very small pillow and it was memory foam which wasn't to my taste. The other bed sheets were fine though.I couldn't get the TV to work, other than the Japanese news channel it defaulted to and the instructions were not clear, but again this wasn't a deal breaker. The air conditioning controller/remote was only in Japanese with no apparent instructions so not quite sure how that worked!My rate included breakfast which had a selection of breads and croissants, a few hot dishes that changed daily and some cold salad options. Plus decent coffee, orange juice and milk.The staff were all very polite, and spoke enough English to get by.When accessing the hotel from Narita Airport, the service provided by "Friendly Airport Limousine" to the nearby Hilton Tokyo was very convenient. You definitely do not want to be dragging bags off and on trains, although the train station is very close making the hotel a top spot for seeing Tokyo and accessing the brilliant rail network.There is a McDonalds next door, a 7-11 just down the road and various other eateries closely about too.

I was shocked by how small the hotel room was. My hubsband and I could barely move around after placing our two suitcases down on the floor. If you open the bathroom door, it would block the way out to the front door. However, I have to admit that the hotel offered everything I could think of. From bath sponge, green tea sachets, to washing machine and trouser iron machine. I guess it would be a good choice for businessman. But for tourists like me who's after a bit of luxury/relaxation, this is not the right place to go.

It was our first experience in a Tokyu Stay hotel and we were satisfied with our choice in a city where accommodation prices are a bit exaggerated. Our three night stay was comfortable, the size of the double room is ok for two people and a big suitcase ;) The staff is friendly and the check in/ check out procedures are as speedy as they can get. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, there is a Starbuck's and a small supermarket nearby if you, like us, want to grab something more western like. It takes around 20 minutes to reach Shinjuku station and 10 minutes to reach Nishi Shinjuku station on Marunouchi Line. From there you can go everywhere you want in the city! On our first night, we were tired and it was very cold outside so we had a late supper in one of the ramen shop around the hotel. For the other nights we preferred to go to Shinjuku, a very lively area where you can find a lot of eating options.Please note the room was not cleaned or vacuumed during our stay but we had a new set of towels everyday.

We stayed 5 nights at this hotel from 18-23 december 2014. After booking our air tickets to Tokyo, we did a tremendous amount of research and finally picked this hotel because of its good reviews, proximity to Haneda airport, Shinjuku stn (15min walk) and the Gochome stn (3mins). We book two rooms over the Internet - without hassle.After some homework we found out that the best way to get there from Haneda is via the airport limousine bus. Cost is 1230/adult one-way. You need to purchase the ticket at a counter shortly after you exit the customs clearance. Then you take the lift down to level 1 and proceed to bus bay #3. Do note that the bus will take you to Hilton hotel. From there it is a 10-15min walk down a straight road (crossing 2 junctions) to the hotel. We drag our luggages and arrived there without any issues. Check in was speedy and we were given 2 rooms on the same floor. The hotel staff is really very friendly, helpful and communicated effectively in english.The rooms were surprisingly large. I have stayed in Tokyo, Osaka, Fukoka in the past and the rooms were tiny compared to this! The bathroom was also very large by japanese standards.There was free breakfast that we all enjoyed every morning. It was a small spread but they change the main dishes every day. It was good enough for us to start the day quickly and early (there's lots to see and do in Tokyo) and then catch some good Japanese food in the shinjuku or Harajuku area.They also have a washer cum dryer in every room- extremely helpful when you travel light. We did our laundry in the evenings - took about 2.5 hours and they (jeans and sweats) came out very dry. They do provide a starter pack of washing detergent enough for a single wash. You can purchase more at 30yen at the reception.Another thing to note is that the rooms are not cleaned and vacummed during our stay - it is actually stated clearly in the reservation confirmatory email. What they do is to replace all towels, and clear the rubbish. It is not the usual hotel service that you may be used to. But we are very ok with this.Our stay was very enjoyable and confortable. We are very grateful to the friendly and professional staff at the hotel - keep up the good work!

We stayed 3 nights and found the rooms very comfortable and no smaller than any other hotels throughout Japan. It was an easy and pleasant 10 minute walk to Shinjuku station and the washing machine within the room was an absolute bonus! The hotel breakfast was tasty and substantial and a couple of wonderful local restaurants nearby.Travelling to and from Narita airport is easy, as is catching the Shinkansen (bullet train) as all relevant trains leave and depart from Shinjuku. However we would advise catching a taxi from Shinjuku station to hotel the first time as it's makes life much easier and only costs around 1200yen.

We spend 3 nights at this hotel. The big advantage is it location which is very close to subway station. The room is quite small but not a big deal. Our bed has a musty smell but it can be solved with air-refresher. We found some problem about remote controls which are Japanese. A guest who stayed before us set the air-conditioning as heater mode, and then we spent a lot of time to switch it to air-conditioning mode. At the end we have to call staff to help.Complimentary breakfast had not many choices. However, there are many restaurants and convenience stores around, including McDonalds next door.

I stayed with my husband for 4 nights. Good location; very clean; comfortable bed; strong, hot water in the shower; but a very tiny room. Staff were very friendly. Metro not far away and many restaurants all around (good pizza down the alley opp. the front of the entrance). Well priced room overall and would stay again.

Overall, this hotel met my needs. Breakfast was included in price and was decent. Room was tiny but that's to be expected as it is Tokyo and we budgeted on this hotel as it was only a test stop for us before heading down to Osaka the next day. Conveniently located in shinjuku and helpful staff. Would stay again.

How do you fit so much into such a small space? The rooms are small but have everything needed for a good stay, the washing machine is awesome. We made this our base and came back here to do our laundry. The rooms were clean and compact, comfortable maybe a little hard for some. The breakfast was well worth the 500 yen. The front desk staff were extremely helpfull and polite (what would you expect for Japan). I would stay here again when in Japan, but maybe upgrade to a larger room.

I have been going to Tokyo for last 4 years. I always had big problem because I am vegetarian.... Survival of vegetarian is really hard in county of FISH...Japan... I need carry my food but biggest problem in Tokyo is getting microwave in hotel room... Then we found Tokyustay.. which has every thing you need a microwave, induction heater, refrigerator... & biggest thing a washing machine... to wash you cloths free... Excellently maintained clean specious room & very supportive staff.

Pros:- 10Mbps symmetrical throughput Internet- The Bath room- Cleanliness- Location- Laundry machine inside the room- Vending machine on the second floor.Cons:- Breakfast could be better- Cellular antenna on the roof! Be aware of staying on top floors. Some say 5-6 floors under the antenna are affected by radiation.

I stayed here for 3 nights in June 2014. The room was small, but was more than adequate for my needs, as I was traveling alone and wouldn't be spending my days in the hotel. The room was clean and the bed was comfy. The washing machine was super convenient, and they give you a complimentary packet of detergent upon check in. As a young woman traveling alone, safety is a huge factor. Room keys are required to gain access to the elevators, as well as to operate them. Non guests are not permitted in the rooms, which for some is an inconvenience, but for me it provided peace of mind. There's a 24 hour McDonald's next door, as well as a curry restaurant and a convenience store. The staff was friendly and helpful. Great stay overall, I would definitely stay with them again!

Hotel location is good - within 2 minutes walk of a subway station and easy walking distance of Tokyo Metropolitan Government building, Shinjuku station and the surrounding area. There are also a few cheap and cheerful restaurants nearby and convenience stores. We were lucky to get an 8th floor room facing on the Tokyo Met building - awesome views day and night - ask for this view if you can get it. The staff were friendly, helpful and mostly spoke good English which also helps useless foreigners such as me. The good aspects are that the rooms are pretty large by Tokyo standards, plenty of room to have 2 large cases and bags, the room comes with a microwave and washing machine and other odds and ends which are all useful when travelling on a longer break. The bathrooms are large and clean with the usual toiletries provided. The only thing that they don't do is there's no room service if you stay less than 7 days, unusual but not a problem if you tidy up after yourself (and they do change towels every day). Would definitely recommend this place - something of a bargain in a pretty expensive area of Tokyo.

Stayed here for 11 nights recently and it was my third time. The room only got cleaned twice during that time and there is no breakfast included so I expect the price to reflect this but it didn't. Another annoying thing is there is no cable just one CNN channel so TV was just not an option unless you like mindless Japanese chat shows and giggling girls. The staff are courteous as one would expect from a Japanese hotel. Basically, you probably won't be staying in the room too long in Tokyo anyway so it has everything one needs albeit in a very condensed way. The washing machine/dryer is a great bonus. We had to evacuate at 4am one morning after waking up to an incredible alarm which would wake even the most drunk guest up warning of a fire on the 11th floor. I collected my friends and after escaping to the outside fire door, once down below the gate was locked and we had to go back inside and out the opposite side. Lucky by the time the fire engines arrived it must have been put under control as they were not needed. I gave the front desk some grief over this the next day as I found this a serious breach of safety.

Tokyustay Nishishinjuku is undoubtedly one of my favorite hotels in Tokyo. I love about its convenient location (close proximity to Nishishinjuku Gochome Station of the Toei Oedo Line) and hearty breakfast, not to mention its helpful and efficient staff and satisfactory service.In addition, I find the washer-dryer and microwave in the room extremely handy. WiFi connection is sufficiently fast.Convenience stores and restaurants abound in the neighborhood.Tokyustay Nishishinjuku is a three-star hotel with a five-star value. Next time I travel to Shinjuku again, the hotel will be my top choice.

I like this hotel because the regular room is relatively bigger than the regular business hotel rooms in Tokyo. They offer free breakfast.I like the corner room because the bathroom is bigger and I love the shower.It's around 20min walk to main Shinjuku station. The government building is 5-10min walk for free entrance to the Observatory if you want to view the Tokyo skyline.I would return here when I'm in tokyo. There's a nearby train station which is 1-2stops from Shinjuku main

Lovely hotel with restaurants and convenient stores nearby. The room is clean and the toilet is big and bright. Didn't like the pillow though as it's too flat. It's 15-20 mins walk to Shinjuku south exit but I didn't mind the distance. If you feel lazy that day, Nishi Shinjuku Gochome station is just nearby. It's 2 stops from there to Shinjuku station.

A very nice place to stay. Though small room but Comfy. There is a washer/dryer inside and its very convenient. There is also a nice green tea spray bottle for the room you can use. Friendly staff. Breakfast is ok for not high expectation people. McDonald's, Curry Rice restaurants and convience store are all nearby. Walking distance to Denny's Restaurant. Around 5-7 mins walk to the subway and 10-15 mins to the Supermarket. Bus stop heading to Shinjuku is also walking distance. A definate place to stay.

After reading the reviews I was concerned about the room size and breakfast but after staying there are no concerns at all! We had a standard room that had plenty of space for bags, it had a fridge, microwave, wahshing machine, bowls, cups etc as well as plenty of desk space for charging phones etc. the air cond was great and the tv worked well. Breakfast was really great if you are will to branch out a bit. I had tomato rice, a really lovely chicken (honey soy) and some salad before taking on the slightly unusual bread offering. Again I thought it was excellent.I would stay here again

As noted, rooms are small but clean-Although bathroom was more about efficiency than style, the shower water pressure and temp. were excellent. My travel pillow was used at night as the hotel pillow was like a bulky foam rock. The beds were extra firm but surprisingly excellent for sleep quality. Hotel staff was neutral- answered questions but not much interaction beyond required greetings. You will get a nice walk going to shinjuku. Walk a route staying to the north of the park when going to and from the hotel to avoid the many homeless living under the overpasses. You will also pass a 24 hour grocery store that is quite convenient. The beer garden at the nearby Hilton was nothing more than plastic tables and chairs on the rooftop and beer was expensive-skip it unless paying $30.00 per person for all the beer you can drink meets your needs for value.  There was no cozy place to hang out in the hotel lobby...to play cards or have a beer-as the lobby is quite sterile and the rooms are too small. We went to McDonalds for coffee pre-breakfast every morning as the hotel coffee cups were very dainty...The hotel breakfast lost appeal after 3 mornings and egg mc muffins at McDonalds next door tasted glorious for our 4th morning. The McDonalds is clean with a local mix and the workers hustle and are really friendly so it's like you're not even in McDonalds.  We chose this hotel as we were traveling with a budget conscious couple and although no regrets as we had a fantastic time, I would pony up some cash for a bit of additional aesthetics and to be closer to trains for the next visit. Can't beat the price.

We are family of 4 and had to stay in 2 separate rooms because rooms are really small. Not a problem, but rooms do not connect to each other. Rooms have small frig, microwave, and hot water pot. We liked the location, few restaurants and coffee shops around, and short walk to Government Building where you have to go to see the view of Tokyo for free. The breakfast was okay but its a good thing my kids will eat anything! When riding the subway there are many Nishi stops - the closest is the Nishi-Gochome, although we went to wrong station and it was not a long walk.

I'm a bit torn with this hotel. It was ok. Positives...It is in a good location (by a subway station but not by Shinjuku Station - 30 min walk). There are some restaurants nearby but you will mostly be taking the train to another area or walking at least 30 minutes to the heart of Shinjuku. The hotel was clean when we arrived. It has a washing machine. This is very beneficial. There is a 24hr McDonalds downstairs. The price. This hotel was MUCH cheaper than other hotels in the area. Negatives...We were not advised when we booked the hotel that our room would not be serviced daily. No one will make the bed, change sheets or remove garbage or do a general clean. We stayed 8 days and the room was cleaned once.The staff are ok but not overly friendly and one gentleman was very rude. The breakfast is ok for travellers on a budget that are ok with toast and a small selection of pastries and soup. We only had the breakfast once. Overall I would recommend this hotel to travellers on a budget. It isn't terrible. I probably wouldn't stay here again though (at least not for an extended stay - longer than 2 nights).
user_name:
Alicia B
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: If you want to feel the vibe of Tokyo, I think this is the right place to stay in. You will be in the heart of Shinjuku, busy district with lots and lots of things to do. The hotel itself is very clean with cosy beds, nice staff and more than reasonable price. Only backdraw might be traditional japanese breakfast served at the hotel lobby which consists mainly of eggs, rice & meat. There is also some pastry with fruit jams but if you want to start your day with healthy stuff, you will be dissapointed.

It's been a really nice stay in this hotel. Near the the nishi-shinjuku-gochōme ( oedo line) subway stop (3 min walk) in the middle of the business area near the government building,this hotel offers a really nice stay. The rooms are nice, clean and we had a really nice view on the city ( requested ). Small bathroom but functional. The concierge staff is very kind and useful. High speed Wi-fi free in all areas. Not excellent buffet breakfast but good. Generally it's been an amazing stay in Tokyo. Tip: Near the hotel there is a little soba restaurant that is excellent!!!!!

This hotel is about 20 minutes walk from the Shinjuku station and taxi from the station is about 700 yen. Shinjuku station is enormous so it takes time just to get to the exit. The hotel design is modern and sleek. The size of the room is compact but very clean and modern and the bed is very comfortable. Having the washer and dryer in the room was very convenient for us. They also offer free in room wifi, free breakfast, and in room safe. The municipal gov't building observatory is nearby so definitely worth dropping by to take in the aerial view. I would recommend this hotel especially for those who can make use of the amenities.

The room was clean and i like it for the fact that there was a washing machine.However the choice for the breakfast was quite limited, but to be fair to them, it was because i stayed there for 9 days. If it was just a 2-3 night stay, the breakfast would do fine.else the 500yen could be better spent elsewhere. Location wise it was near to the nishi shinjuku gochrome station, but the drawback is the high transport cost from this station to Shinjuku JR station.

Very well located. Only minutes from the Nishi-shinjuku gochome subway stop.The rooms were small but very comfortable and breakfast was included a mix of western and japanese food. The service was good except that I was suprised that to check in a little early they have a fee. Lots of small eateries around. Overall good value for the money

We stayed for three nights including breakfast at a non-smooking room.Pro:The room size was sufficient and not too small. There was enough space beside the double bed for a chair, small round table, desk and second chair. The room and bath were very clean. During check-in we received wash powder for the washing machine in our room. It was quiet during the nights. The breakfast was a mix of continental and japanese style and tasted delicious.Contra:We didn't like one thing: the pillows. They were small and hard. But that's our peronal opinion and maybe differ to your experience.

I agree to everything that is written below. While the rooms are small, they are clean and smoke-free (unlike other under $150USD places I have stayed at in the area). My only add is that this place is NOT close to the main Shinjuku station. Will take you at least 25 minutes to get to the main station (remember, it takes at least 10-15 minutes to navigate through some of these Tokyo stations). Nice, quiet area. 24 hour McDs and convenience stores around. There is a good subway line about 5 minutes from the hotel which can get you to Shinjuku station (after a short transfer), so its not too bad. I will definitely stay here again for the price and cleanliness.

We booked this hotel based on location and that there were many good reviews. First off it is well located to the Shinjuku Station about 10-15 min walk. The Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building is about 10 min walk and has a very nice tourist information center. We had breakfast in the hotel, it is very good, it is a traditional Japanese type breakfast. There is a McDonalds right next door if you are a picky eater. The staff is very helpful and friendly. It was very reasonably priced. We would definitely stay here again.

Good hotel, agree with other reviews and would recommend it, not much to complain, beside small crowded breakfast area and very far away from the Narita airport. Dont't stay here if you have a fairly early morning flight, public transport does not start early enough and it takes long. Otherwise the hotel is close to train station.

Firstly, it's really affordable. Even better price if you reserve 21 days in advance. Location is quite good as well just 5 min walk from Shinjuku Go-Chome sta. Clean and with so many practical stuff you can use. My fav was the bottle of cloths and air refresher. Appliances are all quite new. Really nothing to complain.

Room is clean. There is even a washing machine in your room and when you check-in they give you washing powder. There are also a knife, forks and spoons in the drawer near your bed.Breakfast is simple but good. We quite like it. Choices of orange juice, milk, coffee, tea, soup, 4 types of bread, hard boiled egg, vegetables and rice (sometimes fried, sometimes onigiri). There is a small oven so you can reheat your bread, very considerate. We enjoy our stay there and if we visit Tokyo in the future, will definitely stay there again.

When booking this accommodation I must admit I was a but scared as the rooms looked tiny and the price seemed really low. When we finally got to the hotel though I was wowed. Yes the rooms were small, in our group we had 5 rooms (9 people) and the only down side to that was that we couldn't really all just hang out in a room - we got pass this by girls in one room and boys in another (which worked out perfectly anyway)The service was exceptionally well! Sometimes going up to reception you would find someone that doesn't speak english but they would always have someone on that does! This helped us a lot. They were always eager and willing to help out if you need anything.Technology in the rooms were all in Japanese but they have english instructions on the desk so it wasn't that hard to figure things out.The location is amazing too! just a short 2 minute walk to the subway and from there a quick 2 stop ride and you're in the heart of Shinjuku!We decided to go for a walk one afternoon and right across the road was an awesome garden/parkland - spent about an hour in there just walking around and watching the locals do there thing! Last but not least, for all you fussy eaters (we had a few in our group) - McDonalds is literally attached to the building! So if you're not too keen on the traditional japanese food no need to worry! and i must say, McDonalds over there is like 10000 times better than here!I would definitely recommend anyone to stay here! i know for a fact that when i return to Tokyo this is where I'll be staying again :)

This hotel was one of the best I've stayed at in Japan. Last time I stayed in the Washington but this hotel is the one I'll be returning to! staff are friendly and helpful and the neighbourhood is clean and friendly. It's a short 10 minute walk to Shinjuku station and a 1 min walk to the closest subway. The rooms are spacious, clean and modern and the washer dryer are a handy extra to have.

We stayed here for 3 nights. I booked for 3 rooms for 6 people, and this place is amazing! It wasn't expensive at all, and the service, bed, amenities was just great!! It was like an apartment style but with the feel of a hotel. Love it here. The staff were really friendly and they are willing to help you no matter what. The washing machine was such a bonus!! We did our previous 3 days worth of cleaning just in one night! Washing machine can do so much wonder when you on travel! The location is great too, only around 2-3 mins walk to the subway station (Nishishinjuku station). The area around Nishisinjuku is more 'business' style, so if you are into night life, then this hotel might not be for you. However, with Japan subway system you can get to any places easily. We also order the buffet breakfast. It a mix of western + Japanese cuisine. Tasted very nice too. Not expensive and would recommend anyone to add this as part of their stay. All in all, I really enjoy my stay here. One of the best places I have stay so far and would definitely come back here again. For the price you pay this place is well worth it!

Stayed here for 2 nights apon arriving in Tokyo. Found it pretty easy to navigate, in walking distance to the main Shinjuku station (west entrace). Very good value for money, for something in this area. The bathroom was nice, new and clean. Be prepared for a very firm bed! But slept well. Staff answered any questions. Felt safe as a single female travelling alone. Would definitely return!

This hotel was hard to find at first with no general knowledge of area. However, once found it was quite pretty in appearance and upon arrival the staff helped alot and could speak basic english. Downstairs is a curry restaurant, mcdonalds and several convience stores. It is also a short walk from starbucks and make sure you visit the nearby government observation deck.

My friend and I had a quick weekend in Tokyo before departing after some time in Kyoto. We'd rented an apartment for a week in Tokyo the week before, so just needed a clean place to stay our final weekend. We stumbled upon this one via Booking.com who had it sold out. We emailed them directly and were pleasantly surprised they could accommodate us. We booked a semi-double non-smoking. The room was very small, but for what we needed it for (showering and sleeping) it worked out great. The staff was lovely (limited English), the amenities were a great touch, and the English explanations how to use the AC and TV were thoughtful. There is a large supermarket a block away, as well as many convenient stores to stock up on little snacks. I recommend this hotel for a quick stay with a friend/partner, or longer stay on business solo. I also think the hotel should read this and consider arranging the text to match the other Tokyu Stay hotels on Trip Advisor as it was hard to find on here. Also note: the Hilton is a quick walk up a mild hill to catch an easy shuttle bus to / from Narita for 30 yen.

I needed a hotel near to my customer, before i was in the Hyatt Regency. I moved over the weekend into another hotel which was also ok but not in walking distance. Then i found this one. I booked first for 2 days, you never know ... But i really liked it. Nothing to far away, with the Train station nearby you can go to Shinjuku. To the airport (Narita or Haneda) you have to change only one time.The room was not to small and you could open the window! Even i smoke a lot, a like a little bit of fresh air once a day.I picked it also because of the washing machine, first not that easy to understand, but they have a english/japanese manual sheet for the devices (every hotel should have that!). Unfortunately that didn't helped me a lot for the aircon, to many unexplained functions :-) Like in most hotels the positioning of it was wrong. I couldn't work on the desk with the aircon on, until i used some tape to redirect the airflow.Bed was ok, pillow way to small.I extended my stay 3 times, i can recommend this hotel if you are on a budget. I wasn't, still ... :-)I didn't tried breakfast or the TV.

We were travelling to Hokkaido after a stay near Mt Fuji and booked this hotel as the rooms offered a washer-dryer. The hotel is close to the exciting Shinjuku area, but it is a bit of a walk with suitcases. The suggested subway station is an easy walk to this hotel. We met up with others in the evening for dinner in Shinjuku. To get to Shinjuku which is at the other side of the famous government buildings, you need to walk through a park where there are a number of rough sleepers. The hotel was very good value and I think this was possibly due to it's location. The facilities in the hotel were excellent and the staff very helpful. We arrived a little early and left our cases and when we returned the cases were in our room. We were able to wash & dry our clothes ready for the second part of our trip. If you have ever stayed at Toyoko Inn, as we have and thought it was good - this place is even better for the price. We had breakfast included in the price and this too was very good - a buffet with lots of choice. there was free wifi as well as the fridge, kettle & microwave.

Very convenient location. Although it's not really close to Shinjuku Station, (it took me 20 mins to walk to the hotel before I realized I could just change to subway), it is very close to the park and have many restaurant nearby in case you are starving in the middle of the night. It also has McDonald just next to it.I stayed there for three nights. The rooms are small, but I think it is good enough for two people. The pillows are tough. If you are tall, I don't think the bathtub can fit you, but everything else like cleanliness, services are excellent. The staffs speaks English a little bit, so you might have problems communicating with them, but what I see is they put tremendous effort to understand me with little English knowledge, so I think that's good. The breakfast is average, but hey for the price I paid, it's definitely worth it. They have excellent wi-fi connections inside the hotels, including your room.If you're looking for a clean, comfortable hotel but you're not really spending much time inside your room with a good price, this is definitely the hotel you're looking or.

Even though this is not a 5-star hotel (I'd say a 3-star), it still is just perfect: clean, hospitable and full of very convenient amenities. It is located in the quiet and modern part of Shinjuku next (less than 200m) to NISHI-SHINJUKU GO-CHOME, of the Tokyo Municipal Subway (Toei Subway) and a 20-minute walk from Shinjuku Station. The apartment comes equipped with washer/drier, iron and ironing board, microwave, flashlight, slippers, free wi-fi, ... We stayed at a semi-double room for four nights; the room is very clean, of an adequate size for tourists, as well as the bathroom - everything was perfect, including the price (much lower than similar hotels). We plan on going back to Tokyo and we'll definitely go back to this hotel. Breakfast is charged apart (US$5 per person) and was very reasonable.

Hotel has a good location, very near the Shinjuku central park, actually just a few meters away (on the nort-western corner), two minutes walking distance from the Nishi Shinjuku - Gochome metro station (Toei Oedo line) or 20 minutes walk from main Shinjuku metro or JR station. Open 24/7, card access, small rooms but big enough for everything you need with lots of amenites (washing and drying machine, microvawe, water heater, fridge, air condition, trousers iron press...), option of smoking/non smoking room, for couples i reccomend bigger room if available, if you need it that is... They offer laundryservice, dry cleaning (dry cleaner is also few meters up the street if you need one). Staff is very nice, breakfast is affordable (500 YEN), not many variety of choice there, very simple (juice, caffe, milk, water, rice, vegetables, butter, jam, boiled eggs, yoghurt), but the food is quite good, so it is worth the money. High speed WI-Fi also available, working very nice. Next to the hotel there is 24/7 McDonald's, across the street 24/7 supermarket, just minute walk away lots of cool restaurants, caffe's, fast foods, take away's and other interesting places. And the price is, i believe, really top for what you can get, after all this is Tokyo.

The hotel is in great location - west shinjuku, 20 minutes walking or one metro station from shinjuku station. The staff was very helpful. The breakfast was enough. The room is very clean and very well equiped - to the last detail. The room even had washing machine that includes dryer (and the staff gives one bag of washing powder.

Relaxing place but not one subway line stop here. This chain hotel provides everything you need for long stay. We stay here for 5 nights. It provide free wash power to wash our cloths.Near by the hotel, you can find a 24 hour supermarket, a great japanese restaurant, a park for sightseeig.

Stayed for 4 nights in a semi-double room. As expected, it's a very small room, reasonable for the price. The room rate, about 11500 yen per night, included a simple breakfast at the dining area near the main reception. The room is like a small apartment, with washing machine, trousers iron press, microwave, electric kettle and mini fridge. It has a T&B, a hair dryer, writing desk and a flat screen TV. The only downside is that, if you stay for 6 nights or less, no housekeeping service is provided, but they do change the towels and night robes, and empty the trash bin everyday. Location, good because it's: about 2 minutes walk from the subway station; beside a 24hr McDonalds and a couple of restaurants; and very near 3 convenience stores. It's also about 15 minutes walk from Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building. But the most I love about this hotel is the staff, very helpful and polite.

The TokyuStay in Shinjuku is a good find when you've been travelling awhile and need some extras you're unlikely to find elsewhere, like a washer/dryer. The hotel is a 15-minute walk from Shinjuku station, or a short walk downhill from nishishinjuku station. There is one station closer, but it isn't on the same line and is not worth changing for the sake of 100 metres. The room is clean and compact, but those wanting daily room service should look elsewhere as clean towels are delivered daily, but that's it. Make your own bed! The tv was good but worthless unless you speak Japanese, as there isn't even one non-Japanese channel. Wired Internet is free, but no wireless. Bathroom is small-no tub- but is clean. Breakfast was included for us, or able to be purchased for ¥500, but it really isn't very satisfying--a soup, a green salad, some hard-boiled eggs, a rice dish and a bowl of yoghurt. There are some great Japanese places nearby, a Denny's if you must, and the ever present 7-11 for coffee/yoghurt/doughnuts. Staff are helpful and speak a little English. It's a good choice in a decent location and I'd be glad to stay again.

I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and I was very pleased with my stay. I caught the limousine bus from the airport to the Hilton hotel, then it's a simple walk to the Tokyustay. I arrived too early to check in and left my bag with reception staff - when I returned to check in, my bags were already in the room, which I thought was a nice touch.The room is pretty small but it's functional - desk, fridge, air con, large HD television with 12 channels (all Japanese), washer/dryer, microwave, kettle. The bathroom was acceptable - not the cleanest I've seen but it was fine. The breakfast was OK - a bit of a mixed bag, as Japanese hotel breakfasts tend to be!It's in a convenient location - a few hundred yards from Nishishinjuku Gochome subway, next door to a 24-hour McDonalds for the jetlagged Westerner, also 24-hour convenience stores. There's also a park just across the road. It was always easy to navigate back to the hotel, as the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office nearby is very well signposted and easily recognisable in the skyline.I enjoyed my stay at the hotel - very reasonably priced, a pleasant room in a good location.

We booked a deluxe twin room which was located in the corner of the floor. The room was to the large size for Tokyo standard where rooms are normally super small. In room, we had a kitchenette which also comes with washer and dryer. We even had a working area and a small dining area-all in one room. Pretty sure this is rare for tokyo, especially for this price. The staff were not perfect at English but they definitely tried and that counts. I don't remember seeing any English channels on their TV at all. Maybe there were. We just didn't see any.The only thing we weren't too fond of was the location. It wasn't near the Shinjuku station so there wasn't really much shopping or dining scene around. So, if your priority is location, stay elsewhere but if comfort is your number one priority then Tokyustay Nishi Shinjuku is your choice.
user_name:
Asatis
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for 2nights after staying at Ueno. It is very near to Tokyo Metro station. This area is mostly business district but bus stops are nearby and convenient to go to Shibuya. Was very satisfied as the washing/dryer machine is in the room which makes it so convenient. THe hotel do sell washing powder for 30yen (small packet) but we opted to buy from the pharmacy nearby. There are several restaurants opened at night like Ramen shop/Izakaya/Matsuya/Sukiya/McDonalds. Matsuya is highly recommended. Very reasonable and tastes good. They serve Japanese curry/gyudon/etc. They have branches throughout Japan. The hotel provides breakfast at the lobby area for 500yen/person. Very basic menus: scrambled eggs/bacons/ham/several types of bread/soup/coffee/milk/tea. McDonald is just next door if you're bored of the menus here. The room was great but the TV location was bad. With the reflection, one might find it hard to watch TV from the bed. Other than that, it was great. The staffs are very friendly and afternoon staffs at the concierge speak English. You can walk to Hilton hotel to get the airport limousine bus. Would stay again.

The Tokyustay is a handy place to stay if you are travelling around Japan, with facilities such as the washer dryer in your room (to be fair most hotels have coin laundry facilities, but this setup is way more convenient). There's a small kitchenette as well for cooking simple food. There is a basic breakfast there - some days were better than others. The price I paid was certainly good value (though not too sure what rack rate is like). It's a tiny bit further out than some places in Nishi Shinjuku. It's still a pretty good location though (ust past the Hilton) and also there's a subway stop not far away at all.

Just returned from a 3-night visit to Tokyo (first time) and I stayed at the Tokyustay Nishi-Shinjuku hotel. I was very satisified and was very happy with the hotel.The location is great. I took the Airport Limosine bus to the Tokyo Hilton and then walked about 3 blocks to the hotel. There is a subway stop close by so very convenient. It is also an easy walk to Shinjuku station.What I liked is that the hotel is very new so everything is clean and modern. I was shocked at the size of my small single room. TINY. Having said that, it had everything I needed and a huge bonus was the washer/dryer. It is free to use and it takes 90 minutes for a wash/dry cyle. Even though I was only in Tokyo for a short stay I used the washer/dryer and it was a real luxury.The staff was always very friendly and helpful and gave great service. An example, when I checked in I noticed there was only one very small pillow on the bed. When I returned from dinner that night I stopped at the front desk and asked for 2 more pillows. She was very friendly and pillows were delivered within minutes.I was happy that the hotel offered a breakfast but I only did it the first morning because I didn't think it was very good and not appetizing for my tastes. There is a McDonalds directly next door and also several traditional Japanese breakfast fast-food restuarants on the same block.The next time I go to Tokyo I will for sure stay at this hotel again. Perfect for my needs!!!

I stayed in this hotel for Tokyo Marathon. It's very close to the marathon starting point. I like this hotel. Although it's very small but it's new and very clean. They also provide the breakfast. The only problem is it's kind of far away from Shinjuku station. If you want to transit subway, there is no elevator somewhere. However, I think I will stay here again if I need to find a place to live.

After recent stays at the 5 star "flagship" hotels of Shinjuku, this was a nice low cost alternative. A short walk from one train station and easy walk from the nearest Airport Limo bus location at the Hilton.The hotel is bare bones, but with nice amenities. My tiny room included washer, microwave, fridge etc.The flat screen TV was excellent quality, but had limited channels - only in Japanese. The room was modern and well maintained. The bathroom was also small, but functional and I liked the shower controls more than most.Hotel offered continental breakfast included as well as free wired internet.This is 100% prepay upon arrival and has some other less common rules on cleaning of rooms and towels, but the reception staff were very clear. I found the staff to be attentive and always found an English speaker available. The hotel has higher than average security features that were also clearly explained.Nearby stores include a 24 hour McDonald's and several convenience stores with wide range of items.Check out time is strictly enforced with fees for be late.If you need to save money in Shinjuku, this hotel should be considered.

It was quite near to the restaurants and shops and Shinjuku JR station, which meant we didn't have far to go each evening. We liked the water machine near the elevator, meaning we could have cold fresh water. The room was not very spacious, but good enought for 2 persons. Bathroom was bigger than expected. Vending machine on each floor. SevenEleven is right on the corner of main street.

We've stayed from 30 Nov - 04 December 2010 and I must say that the entire experience is a breeze. Everything you could hoped for in a accommodation for family with kid - centrally located, modern, complete amenities (toiletries, washing machine, hair dryer, cabinets, safe, flat screen tv, heater and the list could go on) without putting a hole on your pocket. Did I ever mention that it includes breakfast for a price of Y14000 per night? Real good deal I must say..Well yeah... staff is very friendly and accommodating. 24 hours McDonalds is even few steps away, and it means may be about 5 steps away from the hotel plus other convenience stores and restaurants. Hopefully, they would put up several chains in other parts of Japan so it would be very easy for a traveller to book with the hotel chain in various regions of the country as travellers like me is looking maximize their stay in Japan.

As a family traveling with three small kids, we had a very time finding accommodations in Japan. We would have to book 2 rooms, which would put us at over $400-$500. Then we found out about Tokyo Stay hotels. What a wonderful and convenient hotel chain that is. It made our stay in Japan much more affordable than we ever thought possible. We still needed 2 rooms, but we payed less than $350 for both combined. The website was very well designed, with pictures and videos of the rooms of every location available. All locations are conveniently located near subway stops, in trendy, quiet or busy neighborhoods. We picked Nishi-Shinjuku because of its location. A few blocks from the Oedo subway line and just three stops away from the Shinjuky station, that is crisscrossed by many of the city lines, including the JR line. Going to places was a breeze. To get there from the airport, we took the shuttle to the Hilton Hotel and just walked to our hotel. We did the same thing to get the shuttle back to the airport. The rooms are modern, nice and with everything you need to make your stay comfortable. We were provided with slippers, robes, shampoo, conditioner, hair driers, toothbrushes and toothpaste. There was free internet in the room and lobby, the latter also had printers available for the guests to use. We had continental breakfast included, and it was a generous one with hard boiled eggs, salad, sausage included besides the usual items in this type of menu. The hotel is small, it doesn't have all the extras of larger and pricier hotels, but we didn't come to Tokyo to stay inside anyway...And when we came back after a busy day, we could relax in a beautiful and clean room or if wanted, we could make our hot tea in the microwave provided or even do our laundry in the convenience of our room. And I haven't even mentioned the incredibly gracious staff members, who did everything we needed, even found us information on tours and restaurants nearby. We will never need to look so hard again if we go back to Tokyo. Highly recommended for anyone on a budget who also enjoys comfort and convenience.
